intro: Monnina xalapensis, commonly known as Mexican ironweed, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Monnina xalapensis is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a minor weed in some regions.
